description: Intellerts is an innovative company. Our goal is to help the business stay ahead of its competitors using Artificial Intelligence (AI) tools. We love to maximize the potential of AI and Data Science. Applying AI requires extensive Data Science expertise we harvest the true value of Big Data. Every day, we translate AI technologies and AI research into new business assets. Three core values drive our company and team culture: mastery — being good at what we do (the pursuit of mastery), autonomy — the ability to decide how we do what we do (right to self-organize and self-govern), and purpose - to have a clear understanding of why we do what we do. As a Data Analyst/Engineer, you'll be part of our AIFA project development team and will turn data into information, information into insight and insight into business decisions, and monitor performance and quality control plans to identify improvements. The AIFA project aims to create an ecosystem of finance and audit analytics designed to automate business, financial and internal audit activities using advanced artificial intelligence (AI), machine training (ML), and big data technologies. With the team of experienced specialists, you will develop a modern, multifaceted, integrated, and modular platform for data management and analytics to enable business organizations, financial experts, banks, accountants, business consultants, auditors, and data scientists to create finance, business productivity management, and internal audit data products. You are responsible for: · Create, maintain and optimize data pipeline architecture; · Build on large complex data sets that meet functional/non-functional requirements set by business; · Identify, design, and implement internal process improvements. With your creativity, you will automate manual processes, optimizing data delivery, re-designing infrastructure for greater scalability where needed; · Build and maintain data pipeline infrastructures for optimal extraction, transformation, and loading of data from a wide variety of data sources using SQL, PostgreSQL, and cloud-based technologies like Azure, AWS, Google Cloud; · Work with clients, data and analytics experts to improve our data systems and deliver richer functionalities to our clients; · Use advanced computerized models to extract the data needed and remove corrupted data; · Perform initial analysis to assess the quality of the data; · Working alongside teams within the business or the management team to establish business needs; · Define new data collection and analysis processes. To succeed in this role, you should have the following skills and experience: · Expert knowledge in programming languages: SQL or have a good understanding of data manipulation using PostgreSQL or Microsoft SQL DBMS; · Expert in relational database design and concepts; · Knowledge of Python, R (preferable); · Experience in data models and reporting packages; · Strong verbal and written communication skills; · An analytical mind and inclination for problem-solving; · A high level of mathematical ability and a methodical and logical approach; · Problem-solving skills; · The ability to plan work and meet deadlines; · Accuracy and attention to detail. . Dutch language skills, A2 level or above. In return, we offer you: · Autonomy to define how you are going to do work; · Flexible working hours, ability to work from home, and professional development; · The opportunity to grow in your field in an international company; · The opportunity to learn from professionals; · Excellent environment to expand your knowledge and skills; · Holiday pay (8%) · Holidays – 27 days per year · Representation pay · Pension arrangement – Employer contribution of 50% of the pension premium We are a team with challenging goals. Join us, and let's reach the company and your personal goals together. Let's talk! Only selected candidates will be informed about the further process. To apply, please send your CV and cover letter. Benefits: Flexible working hours Company pension Money for vacation Work from home opportunities Soort dienstverband: Fulltime, Onbepaalde tijd Werkschema: ma-vr Thuiswerken: Tijdelijk vanwege COVID-19

Beschikbare data bruikbaar maken, elke minuut van de dag! Data beschikbaar maken voor analisten en data scientists. Klinkt eenvoudig? Voordat data ook echt bruikbaar is, moet je toch flink wat trukendozen opentrekken. Het begint al met de grote diversiteit in bronnen zoals Google Analytics, CRM- en logistieke systemen, sensoren en social media. Deze data is vaak niet netjes gestructureerd of makkelijk te ontsluiten. En heb je eindelijk de data beschikbaar dan heb je nog een pittige klus deze data slim te organiseren. Laat dit nu juist uitdagingen zijn waar onze data engineers het warm van krijgen. Waarom? Omdat je zoveel kan met data. Maar vooral omdat er zoveel nieuwe technologische innovaties beschikbaar komen. Elke dag is anders, vol met vragen die roepen om mensen die slimme dingen doen met data. “Bijdragen aan dataoplossingen op basis van state-of-the-art architecturen, tools en technieken en ervaren hoe je als data engineer de klant in staat stelt meer waarde uit zijn data te halen; daar gaat mijn hart sneller van kloppen!” – Erik (data architect & engineer bij Nippur) Ben jij er klaar voor? Ben jij die slimme en leergierig data engineer en ben jij toe aan de volgende stap? Kennis opdoen en delen is onze kracht. Deze kennis pas je toe bij onze klanten. Daar ga jij werken aan nieuwe dataoplossingen met de nieuwste tools en technieken. Dit kunnen streaming services zijn in een kafka omgeving, maar ook het bouwen van een datapipeline in Azure voor de data-scientists of een ander vraagstuk van onze klant. Complexe vragen ga jij niet uit de weg. Sterker nog, daar hou jij wel van. Je maakt prototypes om duidelijk te maken wat er mogelijk is met de nieuwste technologieën. Daarna zorg je ook dat de oplossing op de juiste manier gaat draaien in productie. Pas jij bij ons? Je hebt een topdag als je aan de slag bent geweest met cloud data technologieën (bv. Databricks Spark, Docker, Delta Lake of Kafka) Op jouw CV staan ETL-tools, SQL-omgevingen en cloud services als Azure en/of AWS Programmeren vind je leuk, met Python of R kan jij uit de voeten Je hebt een hbo- of wo-diploma Je werkt graag in een team en vindt het vanzelfsprekend om je kennis en ervaring te delen Je bent goed in het analyseren van data en begrijpt wat data scientists nodig hebben Je denkt na over de maatschappelijke dilemma’s in het gebruik van data en in je werk ben je hier bewust mee bezig Passen wij bij jou? Jij krijgt: Veel afwisseling in je werk omdat je als consultant werkt aan dataoplossingen bij klanten in verschillende branches met verschillende uitdagingen Volop ruimte om training te volgen en te leren van je (senior) collega’s Goede werk-privébalans, we werken in Noord-Brabant, Utrecht, Gelderland en Limburg. We zullen je dus niet naar Amsterdam of Groningen laten rijden Een arbeidsovereenkomst voor een jaar (32 - 40 uur per week). Maak jij onze verwachtingen waar dan zetten we die na een half jaar om naar een contract voor onbepaalde tijd Een bruto maandsalaris van € 3.500,- tot € 5.500,- op basis van 40 uur per week (afhankelijk van je leeftijd en ervaring is dit een indicatie en geen absolute grens) Arbeidsvoorwaarden waar je wat mee kan; zoals 30 vakantiedagen, een dertiende maand, een flexibele vervoersregeling en een collectieve pensioenregeling. Heb je een bijzondere situatie? Bespreek het en we doen ons best te bekijken wat mogelijk is

For 70 years, Charles River employees have worked together to assist in the discovery, development and safe manufacture of new drug therapies. When you join our family, you will have a significant impact on the health and well-being of people across the globe. Whether your background is in life sciences, finance, IT, sales or another area, your skills will play an important role in the work we perform. In return, we’ll help you build a career that you can feel passionate about. Job Summary We are seeking a specialist in Analytical Chemistry for our Safety Assessment site located in 's-Hertogenbosch. The department of Chemistry consists of approximately 110 employees divided over the units Analytical and Physical Chemistry, Bioanalysis and Test Item Receipt and Formulation. Our research is diverse and we investigate a multitude of substances with a variety of modern analytical equipment. Our research is focused on enabling the safe use of new substances. The Analytical and Physical Chemistry unit is specialized in method development, validation and analysis of pharmaceuticals, polymers, pesticides and other chemicals in various samples (water, formulations, soil, food). Our labs and equipment are state-of-art including: UPLC-MSMS, GC-MSMS, ICP-MS, GC and HP/UPLC systems and a fully equipped radio-lab. In order to maintain and further improve the science in our analytical team, we are looking for a candidate with a track record in successful method development for GC, U/HPLC and ICP with MS detection.  As a Principal Scientist you: will play an active role in improving the overall scientific level of the team, e.g. by providing topic focused training to junior SDs. will be a prime contact for our clients for technical and scientific questions with regards to analytical chemistry, together with a team of specialists. will take the lead in study design for challenging and non-standard study requests will be involved in reviewing analytical reports for clients. will be actively involved in the optimization of an efficient method development process. Together with fellow study directors (SD) you will review the analytical approach for method development projects, and you will interpret data and results, and adapt strategies. will be troubleshooter for the analytical team when technical and scientific expertise is needed. will represent Charles River at international conferences, give presentations at symposia and to our clients and you will extend our analytical network, both externally and internally within CRL. will play a pro-active role in investigating potential innovations, such as emerging technologies and methods, but also new applications.  The following are the qualifications related to the Principal Scientist position: An academic grade in Analytical Chemistry (MSc or PhD), Minimum of 5 years (but preferable >10 years) of work experience in a leading scientific role in industry or academia Extensive experience in analytical method development Recent scientific contributions in peer reviewed journals and analytical symposia Clear, concise and to-the-point way of verbal communication Excellent scientific writing and presentation skills A critical attitude, customer-oriented, motivated and enthusiastic  Our Offer: A challenging and diverse position in a renowned and modern analytical laboratory Opportunities to develop further in your field of expertise Participating in (international) conferences and symposia Key position in a large team of analytical scientists Competitive salary and benefits An open company culture and a pleasant, informal atmosphere About Safety Assessment Charles River is committed to helping our partners expedite their preclinical drug development with exceptional safety assessment services, state-of-the-art facilities and expert regulatory guidance. From individual specialty toxicology and IND enabling studies to tailored packages and total laboratory support, our deeply experienced team can design and execute programs that anticipate challenges and avoid roadblocks for a smooth, efficient journey to market. Each year approximately 120 investigational new drug (IND) programs are conducted in our Safety Assessment facilities.

Complexe data van grote omvang met behulp van algoritmes omzetten naar oplossingen. Dat is de basis van jouw uitdaging. Jouw doel is het verbeteren van klantoplossingen, business modellen en operationele processen door het geautomatiseerd vertalen van data naar informatie. Ben jij een ervaren data scientist met ruime kennis van het ontwikkelen van algoritmes? Dan maken we graag kennis met jou!   Wij zoeken voor ENGIE Digitaal Nederland in Bunnik een Data Scientist.  Dit ga je doen als Data Scientist Als data scientist bij ENGIE ben je verantwoordelijk voor het ontwikkelen van algoritmes en het beantwoorden van digitale vraagstukken met behulp van data. De basis voor jouw werkzaamheden is relevante data. Je bent verantwoordelijk voor het verkrijgen en selecteren van relevante data en het vertalen van deze data naar informatie om betere beslissingen te kunnen nemen, te differentiëren in klantoplossingen, operationele efficiëntie te verbeteren en toekomstige business modellen te ontwikkelen.  De digitale vraagstukken waarmee je aan de slag gaat, hebben betrekking op data waarvan de omvang erg groot en complex is. Data komt real-time binnen en moet vaak real-time toegepast worden. Je benadert vraagstukken vanuit verschillende invalshoeken en komt met diverse mogelijkheden om een probleem op te lossen. Je bent gewend om een grote hoeveelheid aan informatie snel om te zetten in een eenvoudig concept.  In jouw functie als data scientist werk je veel samen met zowel interne als externe stakeholders. Intern zijn dat je collega’s binnen IT zoals solution en domain architecten, maar ook product managers. Jouw externe contacten zijn met name gesprekken met opdrachtgevers. Je maakt deel uit van het Digital Business Center en rapporteert in deze functie aan de Directeur ENGIE Digitaal Nederland.  Dit zijn je belangrijkste taken en verantwoordelijkheden: Je draagt zorg voor het verkrijgen en ontsluiten van de relevante data. Je behandelt vraagstukken die leiden tot toegevoegde waarde uit beschikbare data, mitigerende maatregelen of een hogere performance (KPI’s). Je zorgt voor een professionele ontwikkeling, executie en beheer van algoritmes. Dit doe je op basis van de gewenste IT architectuur, waargenomen trends in de markt en ervaringen uit grote projecten. Je levert input voor het centrale datamodel. Je vertaalt complexe materie naar een business context voor ENGIE. Je werkt samen met verschillende interne en externe partijen voor het verkrijgen van relevante data en het opstellen van predictieve modellen. Beiden met aandacht voor de data kwaliteit en het datamodel. Je werkt volgens geformuleerde kwaliteitseisen voor producten en diensten. Je vormt de brug tussen data en de opdrachtgever door het toepassen van onder andere machine learning. Je volgt de nieuwste ontwikkelingen op het gebied van technologie en processen binnen data science. Je leert van elkaar, daagt elkaar uit én kan tegelijkertijd zelf het verschil maken voor collega’s en opdrachtgevers. Postdoc Position Active Sensing & Control for Hydrofoil Craft under Uncertain Loading Apply Now Hydrofoil craft offer a reliable and cost-efficient solution where high-speed waterway transportation is desired but require sophisticated on-board control systems to ensure that the vessel motions are safe and comfortable for passengers. Especially in harsher ocean environments the reliability of the control system is critical. Such control systems must accurately estimate the hydrofoil position, velocity, and the stochastic wave environment and be responsive enough for quick maneuvering. Current solutions suffer from inaccurate estimates of the system parameters like lift and drag coefficients and from unreliable predictions of short-term excitation conditions. Therefore, to ensure reliable operation over a wide spectrum of environmental conditions, we seek a Postdoc to construct a novel hybrid control design that exploits a risk-averse statistical analysis of acquired environmental data and high-fidelity sensor fusion. Job description The Postdoc will work with the Ship Hydromechanics group (Maritime & Transport Technology) and the Data-Driven group (Delft Center for Systems and Control). The goal of the project is to leverage sensor fusion techniques to predict the state of hydrofoil craft and assign control inputs to optimize its response to random wave excitation. Using the HEARP hydrofoil education and research platform at TU Delft as a case study, the Postdoc will design optimal sensor layouts on the platform to robustly quantify uncertain parameters and excitation factors and will exploit these results to obtain robust optimal controllers. Aided by the expertise of both research groups, she(he) will develop control algorithms that will be tested in physical experiments on the hydrofoil platform to quantify controller performance and hydrofoil reliability. The department Delft Center for Systems and Control (DCSC) of the faculty Mechanical, Maritime and Materials Engineering, coordinates the education and research activities in systems and control at Delft University of Technology. The Centers' research mission is to conduct fundamental research in systems dynamics and control, involving dynamic modelling, advanced control theory, optimisation and signal analysis. The research is motivated by advanced technology development in physical imaging systems, renewable energy, robotics and transportation systems. The essence of the department Maritime and Transport Technology is to develop, design, build and operate marine, dredging and transport systems and their equipment. New generation transport and marine systems have to be based on new concepts. This requires the further development of the knowledge of the dynamics and the physical processes involved in transport, dredging and marine systems, the logistics of the systems and the interaction between the equipment and control systems. Requirements The ideal candidate has a background in automatic control, sensor fusion, maritime technology, signal processing, or a related field, and strong theoretical knowledge combined with an application focus. Experience in running physical experiments and collecting/processing data is highly desirable. A strong command of the English language and good communication skills are also required. What will you be doing? Electric Vehicles (EVs) are increasingly becoming an alternative for road transportation due to their potential environmental benefits and the depletion of carbon-based fuels resources. However, a wider application of such EVs still needs to overcome several technological barriers, many of them given by limitations in battery technology. Batteries are the main source of energy of an EV and it is also the most expensive component. Therefore, strategies that lead to extended the battery life (i.e., less ageing) can have a positive effect in a wider implementation of EVs.  One of the strategies that can be used to extend the battery life, consist of improving modelling techniques such that the internal degradation processes of the batteries are better understood. One strategy consist of using battery models based on physics-based phenomena’s. These models can describe internal battery states (such as potentials, and concentrations), which are not measurable with sensors. However, identifying the model parameters is not a trivial task because of the equations complexity and limited input/output sensor information.  The purpose of this assignment is to analyse, combine and implement the benefits of state-of-the-art techniques for non-intrusive model identification techniques for battery systems. The assignment covers the following tasks: Familiarize with physics-based models of batteries. Critical state-of-the-art revision of non-intrusive identification techniques. Identifiability analysis of the model parameters using current and voltage data. Design and implementation of an algorithm to identify model parameters with multiple experiments. Algorithm testing with simulation data and (if time allows) with measured data from battery cells. Reporting writing. Final presentation to colleagues.  This assignment can be divided in two parts, where the first part is carried out as an internship and the second part as a master thesis. What do we require of you? You have a bachelor’s degree in a relevant field, for example, electrical or chemical engineering. You are coursing a master in a relevant field such as control systems. You have broad experience in Matlab/Simulink. You have previous experiences/courses with control systems, especially related to optimization and modelling techniques. Modelling of chemical processes is desired but not a must. Modelling of batteries is desired but not a must. What can you expect of your work situation? You will work together with a team of enthusiastic scientists with broad experience in automotive systems, battery systems, control systems, and power electronics. Your assignment will be part of a large-scale European project which seeks the further development of batteries. If the time-frame allows, your developments will be validated in real battery system. You will have the opportunity of familiarize yourself with the company’s operation, which opens up the opportunity of building a carrier in TNO beyond your assignment. What can TNO offer you? You want to work on the precursor of your career; an internship gives you an opportunity to take a good look at your prospective future employer. TNO goes a step further. It’s not just looking that interests us; you and your knowledge are essential to our innovation. That’s why we attach a great deal of value to your personal and professional development. You will, of course, be properly supervised during your internship and be given the scope for you to get the best out of yourself. Naturally, we provide suitable internship compensation.
